sub_topic: Calculating the surface area of a cylinder.
message_1: A cylinder has a radius of 5 cm and a height of 7 cm. What is its surface area?
message_2:
The surface area of a cylinder can be found using the formula:

Surface Area = 2πr(h + r)

where r is the radius and h is the height of the cylinder.

In this case, the radius (r) is 5 cm and the height (h) is 7 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Surface Area = 2π(5)(7 + 5)
Surface Area = 2π(5)(12)
Surface Area = 10π(12)
Surface Area = 120π

The surface area of the cylinder is 120π square centimeters, or approximately 376.99 square centimeters.
